alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 8:19PM MDT until June 16 at 1:01AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver CO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Platte River at Fort Morgan. * WHEN...From this evening to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, There is minor flooding of agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM MDT Tuesday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain near or slightly above above flood stage through Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage again early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.9 feet on 06/15/2015. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
